content:
I am currently a first-year graduate student in the laboratory of Dr. Rui Lu at the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB), under the program of Genetics, Genomics, and Bioinformatics (GGB) Using a combination of CRISPR/Cas9 genome editing, deep sequencing of the epigeneic modifications, genome-wide epigenomic profiling, single-cell transcriptomics, and integrative bioinformatics analysis, my work centers on understanding the stepwise distinct epigenetic modifications that underlie the emergence of Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML), critical oncogenic pathways, and use the knowledge to develop targeted therapeutic approaches.
My main interest lies in studying how complex patterns of high-throughput (-omics) data can be integrated and analyzed together to understand the complex biology. I primirily use R programming for data cleaning, data wrangling, visualization and exploratory analysis. I also write linux scripts and Snakemake workflows for building in house NGS pipelines.
